p: There are few reports about the antiviral activity of Hyptidinae extracts, essential oils or isolated compounds. The anti-HIV activity of oleanolic acid ( 75) (IC 50 21.8 μg/mL) and pomolic acid ( 88) (IC 50 23.3 μg/mL), isolated from H. capitata, was demonstrated ( Kashiwada et al., 1998). Almost 20 years later, a report showed the activity of the essential oil from Cantinoa mutabilis (syn. Hyptis mutabilis), containing 1,8-cineole ( 250), fenchone ( 253), bicyclogermacrene ( 264) and β-caryophyllene ( 262) as the main compounds, on human herpes viruses types 1 and 2, respectively, at a concentration of 50 μg/mL ( Brand et al., 2016).
